articles.description: Oswego County reports 36 additional residents have tested positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday, bringing the total number of positive cases to 980. "We must avoid non-essential gatherings," says Oswego County Public Health Director Jiancheng Huang. "We’re w…

articles.author: Ben Guarino, Joel Achenbach
articles.title: These venues are high-risk areas for spreading the coronavirus, model suggests - The Washington Post
articles.description: Setting capacity limits on businesses and other indoor locations can effectively lower the risk of transmission, according to a study of the way people moved.
articles.content: The study provides statistical support for a strategy built around limiting capacity at indoor venues such as capping crowds at 20 percent while allowing those locations to remain open. The researche… [+7808 chars]

articles.author: James Gorman
articles.title: Mink and the Coronavirus: What We Know - The New York Times
articles.description: Mink are the only animal known to both catch the virus from people and transmit it to them.
articles.content:
Last week, Denmark announced its intention to cull all farmed mink, some 17 million, out of fear that a mutated version of the coronavirus might diminish the effectiveness of potential vaccines.
